intro: Peucedanum chenur, commonly known as Chinese cow parsley, is a herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its seeds are used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits.
